conversion_verification.notes: Second image shows an isometric cutaway with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and interior volume; roof/ceiling is removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with readable corner geometry and a clean cutaway; perspective is stable and interior is visible. Minor simplification of some wall tops/cut edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: garage front-right, entry/study zone, master suite bottom-left with ensuite/WIR, theatre left, central kitchen/pantry, large living/dining to right, alfresco at top-right, bed cluster/activity at top. Some proportional differences and a few partition/door placements appear simplified compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present: beds in bedrooms, seating in living/theatre, dining sets, kitchen island/counters, and bathroom fixtures. Placement is mostly consistent with room functions; a few items are generic blocks.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, openings, and rooms are readable with consistent materials and no obvious mesh breaks. Lighting is adequate but somewhat flat, and some interior partitions blend due to similar tones.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion drift: some room widths/partition offsets (notably around the wet areas/pantry corridor) appear simplified versus the 2D plan.
Door/window fidelity is not fully verifiable: several openings are present but exact door locations/swings and window counts/sizes do not perfectly track the 2D drawing.
Furniture is simplified and may not match exact 2D fixture positions (acceptable for block-level staging).

summary: A true 3D cutaway model with strong overall plan fidelity and correctly staged rooms, with only minor proportional and opening-placement deviations from the 2D floor plan.
